metadata.Title: CVE-2020-14342 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - low.
metadata.Description: It was found that cifs-utils' mount.cifs was invoking a shell when requesting the Samba password, which could be used to inject arbitrary commands. An attacker able to invoke mount.cifs with special permission, such as via sudo rules, could use this flaw to escalate their privileges.

criterions.comment: cifs-utils package in hirsute was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:6.11-0ubuntu1').
